definition: Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: As Cicero eloquently put it, "He brought philosophy down from the skies.
sentences.chinese: 正如西塞罗所描绘的，“他把哲学从天上拉了下来。”

sentences.english: So, Cicero first warned us against the danger of being lackadaisical .
sentences.chinese: 西塞罗首先警告我们要注意萎靡不振的危险。

sentences.english: This attitude was equated with justice by Cicero.
sentences.chinese: 西塞罗将这种态度看成是正义。

sentences.english: The sphere preserved to the Roman sacra in the time of Cicero, was not less in extent.
sentences.chinese: 西塞罗时代罗马家祭所保存的范围，也并不小于印度。

sentences.english: These men joined Cicero with themselves, for they had always esteemed him.
sentences.chinese: 这些人自己加入西塞罗，因为他们一致敬重他。

sentences.english: In this story, Scipio encounters his dead father who embraces and kisses him.
sentences.chinese: 其中还描述到西塞罗看见了他死去的父亲还亲吻了他。

sentences.english: Finally, it has analysed the Ciceronian equal grade Taoist temple.
sentences.chinese: 最后分析了西塞罗的等级平等观。

definition: Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Horace, full Latin name Quintus Horatius Flaccus (65-8 BC), Roman poet
Thucydides (c. 455 - c. 400 BC), Greek historian, author of the History of the Peloponnesian War
Pericles (c. 495-429 BC), Athenian strategist and politician before and at the start of the Peloponnesian war
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Brutus (name)/Marcus Junius Brutus (85-42 BC), late Roman Republic politician who conspired against Julius Caesar/Lucius Junius Brutus (6th c. BC), founder of the Roman Republic
